conclusion: The problem involves a square wire frame and a magnetic field, asking for the potential difference between points a and b.
The image shows a square wire frame with side length 0.2 m, half in a magnetic field directed into the paper.
Plan to analyze the image, identify components, and apply electromagnetic induction principles.
The wire frame is a square with a side length of 0.2 m.
The magnetic field is uniform and directed into the paper, perpendicular to the square.
The wire frame is connected at points a and b, creating a loop.
The magnetic field affects only half of the square, inducing a potential difference.
Apply Faraday's law of induction: a change in magnetic flux through a loop induces a potential difference.
The magnetic flux is proportional to the area of the affected half of the square and the magnetic field strength.
Calculate the area of the affected half of the square: 0.5 × (0.2 m)² = 0.02 m².
The rate of change of the magnetic field is 10 T/s.
Calculate the induced potential difference: 10 T/s × 0.02 m² = 0.2 V.
The potential difference between points a and b is 0.2 V.
